Lead, Strategic Integration, Artificial IntelligenceFORUM MONDIAL DE L'ECONOMIEBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:24 April 2024Pensum:100%Vertrag:Festan
stellungArbeitsort:GenfLead, Strategic Integration, Artificial Intelligence  About the World Economic Forum    The World Economic Forum, committed to 
improving the state of the world, is the international organization for public-private cooperation. The Forum engages the foremost political, business
 and other leaders of society to shape global, regional and industry agendas.    About the Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution (C4IR)    This 
position is part of the Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution (C4IR). The Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution (C4IR) helps leaders antic
ipate exponential technologies and drive responsible sectoral and industry transformation. The C4IR brings together leaders from business, government,
 international organizations, academia and civil society to shape the global agenda on technology governance and technology applications for industrie
s and society.    About the Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution Network (C4IR Network)    The Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution Netw
ork accelerates the responsible adoption of technology and transformation of industry at the national, subnational and global levels via policy-making
, pilots and partnerships. In just six years, the Network has grown to 19 centres across five continents, with measurable impact at local and global l
evels.    Why we are Recruiting    In recent decades, the utilization of technology in national development has surged remarkably. From the era of ind
ustrialization and mechanization to the era of wireless connectivity and the proliferation of mobile devices, technological advancements have facilita
ted the leapfrogging of inequities and paved the way for economic growth and development.   As Artificial Intelligence (AI) and other cutting-edge tec
hnologies continue to fuel the digital economy, their impact and influence on governments, enterprises, institutions, and individuals are increasingly
 evident. AI holds immense potential to significantly accelerate existing strategies while also offering novel solutions to global economies. However,
 the harnessing of AI opportunities has been uneven across regions.   Launched in June 2023, the AI Governance Alliance (AIGA) aims to provide guidanc
e on the responsible design, development, adoption, deployment, and governance of AI. It seeks to address these challenges by delineating the enablers
 of AI adoption and devising sustainable solutions tailored to the diverse challenges encountered by different countries and regions in implementing t
hem, thereby bridging regional and country-level gaps in AI technology.   Recognizing both the significant economic and social potentials of AI, the a
ccompanying risks of cutting-edge technologies, and the need of a regional approach, C4IR collaborates closely with the Network of Affiliate Centres f
or the Fourth Industrial Revolution to address these issues.   The Regional Agenda Lead, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning will play a key 
role in advancing AIGA’s mission and will work closely with the network of independent C4IR Affiliate Centers to promote AI adoption, address specific
 challenges faced by industry and other sectors in different countries and regions for the responsible and inclusive development of AI.   Relevant foc
us areas include:   Identifying best practices across industries to facilitate regions in scaling and deploying AI effectively, including necessary en
ablers such as infrastructure and public-private partnerships.   Recognizing the urgent need of countries of all sizes to establish their own AI ecosy
stems and the importance of adapting existing solutions to suit their specific contexts - unlocking the unique capabilities of AI for countries and re
gions with varying resource levels   Exploring, accelerating and scaling across countries multistakeholder collaborations or pilots which have the pot
ential to accelerate AI adoption, usage, and deployment in a safe and inclusive way      Reporting Lines and Interactions    The Lead, Strategic Integ
ration, Artificial Intelligence will report to the Digital Technologies Portfolio Manager, based in Geneva. Operating within an entrepreneurial and dy
namic environment, the Lead will navigate multiple teams and geographic locations to effectively fulfil the responsibilities of the role.   This role 
entails close collaboration with various stakeholders, including the broader AIGA team located in Geneva, San Francisco, New York, China, and Japan. A
dditionally, there will be interaction with the C4IR Network and Partnerships team, serving as key liaisons for independent national/thematic C4IR cen
tres, as well as direct engagement with staff from these affiliate centres.     Breakdown of main responsibilities    The Regional Agenda Lead, Artifi
cial Intelligence and Machine Learning position is of critical importance for advancing Forum’s work on AI, expanding the C4IR network, and increasing
 the engagement of Affiliate Centres by ensuring their deeper and strategic integration into global  Forum initiatives.   The main responsibilities in
clude:    Strategic integration and thought leadership    Stay abreast of the latest developments in the Fourth Industrial Revolution and related fiel
ds, providing thought leadership within the organization and externally   Lead the workstream on ‘National AI Ecosystems’, focused on advancing the tr
ansformation of driven by AI at a regional and national level. This entails:   Engage industry leaders, governments, and other constituents to co-crea
te guidelines, tools and frameworks to enable transformation and promote and accelerate responsible adoption of AI in countries and regions   Work clo
sely with the C4IRNetwork and Partnerships team, and the Independent Centres to foster collaboration with local and regional stakeholders to shape wor
kstreams which can drive impact and support ongoing regional work around AI in a strategic way     Develop and implement the strategic integration str
ategy with the C4IR affiliate Centres to ensure seamless collaboration with the World Economic Forum on the topic of AI and digital technologies – con
necting them at the global level end enabling them to drive their regional agendas   Incubate and kick off new projects where needed and ensure output
s and ambition levels are aligned with the other Forum’s activities     Collaborate with C4IR Network and Partnerships team to ensure the successful d
elivery of relevant joint AIGA-C4IR independent centres events and other deliverables where network members actively contribute, to strengthen the C4I
R agenda and community, and advance AIGA objectives and deliverables.      Community engagement    Manage and animate multistakeholder communities by 
communicating updates regularly, lead working group meetings, onboarding the relevant stakeholders   Connect regularly with community members to stay 
at the forefront of the applications, impact and implications of digital technologies   Cultivate and maintain strategic partnerships with key C4IR Af
filiate Centres, relevant organizations, governments, and industry leaders to advance the goals of the C4IR      Team and resources    Work with Forum
 partner organizations to onboard new fellows to support with the work, and work closely with project fellows to drive the initiatives forward   Work 
closely with the Forum AI team based in India, China and Japan   Drive cross-functional collaboration within the Forum ecosystem to leverage resources
 and expertise for maximum impact      Preferred Requirements and Experience    Master’s degree preferred in a relevant field such as business, policy

ogy business, government or international organizations in positions covering topics of AI and frontier technologies partnership, data, innovation, or

n and spoken English. Strong communication and presentation skills, and experience designing, managing and facilitating communities, workshops, and me
etings both virtually and in person. Strong ability to write informative and insightful content.   Demonstrated ability to work across different cultu
res and with high level officials and executives, and in a fast-paced environment.   Proven excellent project management skills; attention to detail; 
capacity to apply critical thinking, synthesize various viewpoints, consult broadly, communicate clearly, turning ideas into tangible action and impac
t, and manage both long- and short-term objectives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.   Excellent ability to manage relationships externally and in
ternally.   Collaborative, agile, and results oriented.          Why work at the Forum:    The Forum believes that progress happens by bringing togeth

cherchons un Data Scientist pour un client dans le secteur public à Genève. 🎯Votre mission  Le data scientist a pour mission de de collecter les donné
es pertinentes, de les nettoyer et de les préparer pour l’analyse, puis d’appliquer des techniques statistiques et des algorithmes d’apprentissage aut
omatique pour extraire des informations utiles. Le data scientist doit développer des modèles de data science et d’IA en utilisant des techniques tell
es que le Deep Learning, le Computer Vision, le Langage Naturel, le Reinforcement Learning, ou d’autres méthodes d’apprentissage automatique avancées 
selon les besoins spécifiques du projet. Collecte et analyse des données : collecter les données à partir de sources variées (automatiser l’extraction
, l’intégration et la mise à jour des données) et les analyser pour en extraire des informations utiles. Analyse exploratoire des données : Explorer l
es données pour en comprendre la structure, les tendances et les relations, en utilisant des outils statistiques et des visualisations de données OCSI
N Développement des algorithmes et des modèles de data science et d’IA : Concevoir et développer des algorithmes et des modèles de data science et d’I
A et améliorer les résultats. Évaluation des modèles de data science et d’IA: Évaluer la performance des modèles en utilisant des mesures appropriées 
et ajuster les modèles en conséquence pour améliorer leur précision et leur généralisation. Intégration et déploiement des modèles de data science et 
d’IA: Collaborer avec des ingénieurs logiciels pour intégrer les modèles dans des applications ou des systèmes existants. Assurer le déploiement effic
ace et sécurisé des modèles en production. Présenter et partager les résultats: Présenter les résultats de manière claire et compréhensible aux partie
s prenantes.  💼 Votre profil Compétences primordiales (5 années d’expérience et plus) :  Très bonnes connaissances en Python et de Jupyter Très bonnes

ssances du Machine Learning et du Deep Learning Très bonnes connaissances de la qualité des données Bonnes connaissances des principes liés à l’organi
sation orientée service (approche ITIL) • Bonnes connaissances de la technologie de gestion des bases de données Formation : Diplôme (Bachelor ou équi
valent) en statistiques, mathématiques, informatique ou domaine similaire  Compétences importantes :  Aider les métiers à définir des objectifs réalis
tes en se basant sur leurs besoins et leurs données. Se montrer autonome dans la réalisation et le déploiement des algorithmes et des modèles de data

nalyst 100% (m/f/d)Curaden AG, headquartered in Kriens near Lucerne, is an innovative family business and stands for an idea, for a system, for a phil
osophy in terms of comprehensive oral health. Better health for you - with this central promise, we develop, market and distribute products for dentis
try and dental care worldwide under the brand CURAPROX. With this brand, we are now represented in over 90 countries on six continents. In addition, w
e have been advising dental professionals in practices and laboratories with solutions for sixty years and offer all the necessary products for custom
er-oriented practice operations. Our goal is to create a win-win-win situation between patient-dentist-Curaden. We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst t
o join our Digital Sales Department. This department oversees the company’s online distribution channels and mobile applications. The primary objectiv
e of this role is to utilise data to steer strategic decision-making and enhance business performance while establishing robust reporting systems and 
processes. Your focus will be to offer actionable insights that optimise the performance of our digital solutions by harnessing the power of data and 
transforming it into strategic insight to further refine these solutions. In this capacity, you will supervise one individual. This role is pivotal in
 monitoring and reporting on key metrics, facilitating data-informed decision-making, and contributing to the overall success and expansion of our dig
ital solutions and activities. We expect from this position to enhance visibility into performance, improve the ability to identify optimization and g
rowth opportunities, increase effectiveness in driving continuous improvement, and provide better insights into the profitability of our activities. S
enior Data Analyst 100% (m/f/d) Your tasks  Lead a subteam and improve operations and performance of the team responsible for providing insights from 
digital data. Take ownership of the pipeline of data and analytics use cases across the digital products managed by the team. Establish and monitor us
e case value delivery and KPIs and regularly review performance with key stakeholders. Translate business inquiries into analytical solutions and use 
cases that produce actionable insights. Define data requirements, data models, and data architecture to support further analysis. Lead and conduct adv
anced data analysis to derive meaningful insights and guide strategic decision-making. Apply statistical techniques, predictive modeling, and machine 
learning algorithms to extract insights, foster innovation, and optimize business performance. Provide strategic guidance and actionable recommendatio
ns to stakeholders based on data insights. Present data-driven insights and recommendations to non-technical stakeholders in a clear and concise manne
r. Ensure compliance with data protection regulations, privacy laws, and industry standards in data management and analytics activities. Collaborate w
ith legal and compliance teams to address any data-related legal and ethical considerations. Develop and implement data management strategies, includi
ng data governance, data quality, and data integration, to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data. Cultivate a collaborative and innovative team 
culture, promoting knowledge sharing and continuous learning.  Your profile  Hold a Bachelor of Science (or equivalent) in Data Science, Computer Scie
nce, Engineering, Management Information Systems, IT, MBA, or possess equivalent commercial experience and discipline. Demonstrated leadership experie
nce, with the ability to motivate and guide teams. Demonstrate extensive experience (preferably in healthcare) with relevant working knowledge in deli
vering actionable analytical insights that drive positive business results. Possess strategic business acumen and understanding of commercial and mark
eting approaches. Exhibit proficiency in analytical methods, statistical models and tools, and hypothesis building. Have the ability to communicate an

FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZürichSenior Consultant - Financial Services Consulting Actuarial in Zurich Senior Consultant - Financial Services Consulting
 Actuarial in Zurich     The opportunity    Our Consulting business offers a broad range of functional and cross-country services dedicated to providi
ng high-value and trusted advice to clients, with a specific focus on business transformation programs in the Financial Services industry. Globally, o
ur Actuarial Consulting teams count over 650 professionals, ranking us in the Top 3 actuarial services practices in the world. In Europe we have over 
400 actuarial professionals across 17 countries.    Your Key Responsibilities     Pursuing exciting initiatives in the Financial Services industry acr
oss banking, insurance, and reinsurance clients This is a unique opportunity to explore a wide range of solutions to our clients’ issues. Allowing you
 to develop a wide breadth of skills and competencies, with many of these being focused around the key actuarial processes and techniques. The nature 
of Consulting promises a fast paced and engaging career. You will also have the opportunity to work in developing new ideas on current industry issues
. You will work on client assignments from day one with a supportive and highly experienced team. By working for multiple clients, you will use analys
es and modelling techniques to achieve a thorough understanding of business and technical issues enabling you to provide constructive advice and suppo
rt to our clients. Assignments in either Non-Life (P&C/GI) or Life Insurance and Reinsurance. You will have the opportunity to experience new and dive
rse aspects of the actuarial profession. This includes actuarial audit support and reserving, financial reporting (e.g. IFRS 17) and capital modelling
 (e.g. SST). You will also have the opportunity to explore other areas like machine learning / analytics, M&A and Risk Management. You will assist sen
ior management at our clients and build your international profile by working in global reach projects with multicultural teams both in Switzerland an
d abroad. You will be responsible for your own deliverables as well as for coaching and managing junior staff. Taking responsibility and leading the d
elivery of project streams and internal initiatives Collaborating with key stakeholders, business partners, and multi-disciplinary teams to help shapi
ng ideas, designing solutions, and delivering measurable, sustainable improvements in business performance  Applying storytelling skills and presentin
g recommendations to our clients in a clear and logical manner Leveraging and further developing our global EY methodologies, frameworks, tools, accel
erators, and enablers for a range of transformation goals Driving internal topic roundtables and thought leadership sessions Helping to drive go-to-ma
rket and business development initiatives to continuously provide valuable solutions for our clients.   Skills And Attributes For Success     At least
 3 years of relevant work experience in the Financial Services Industry and/or experience in a management consultancy practice. You have experience in
: Software asset development Software product lifecycle management Data Management and analytics   You have fresh ideas, an innovative mind and have a
 strong desire to structure and solve problems. You have experience in either life or non-life (re)insurance; IFRS 17 experience is considered a major
 plus. Excellent infrastructure and security requirements knowledge. You have a strong academic record, ideally with a degree in Actuarial Science, Ma
thematics, Economics or related. Fluency in English. German or French language skills are considered a strong advantage. Strong motivation to join a d
ynamic consulting environment and to work in the financial services sector. Distinctive problem-solving skills and good business judgment. Strong writ
ten and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of management and partners from a variety of business functions.
 Strong stakeholder management skills. Strong team player with a client-oriented attitude, willing to proactively drive solutions within highly motiva
ted and diverse teams across functions and geographies.   Ideally you will also have   Experience and/or interest in leading a small team within a pro
ject stream. Knowledge in machine learning and programming (R, Python) and data visualization (Power BI). Strong connection in the Financial Services 
Industry.   What we look for   You are a team player with a flexible working style who enjoys working with diverse teams. You are prepared to challeng
e us, to act on your own initiative and to make an impact on our teams and clients from day one.   What We Offer     EY Switzerland offers you to work
 in a diverse and inclusive environment with colleagues coming from all over the world. You will work with and learn from experienced professionals an
d continuously develop yourself as we invest an important share of our annual turnover in the personal development and trainings of our employees.    
Furthermore, we offer attractive benefits to our employees, included but not limited to the following:       Further education: At EY, you have the po
ssibility to earn an accredited Masters in Sustainability, an accredited Masters in Business Analytics or an accredited MBA (EY Tech MBA) from the Hul
t International Business School, free of charge*. Additionally, you can also choose ad-hoc courses in one of our online education partners (e.g., Udem
y) and join EY-specific knowledge sharing sessions & trainings.  Hybrid working model: We offer working from home and flexible working options for our
 employees.  Work-life balance: Take 5 weeks of holidays per year as a standard and compensate your overtime at will.  Social contributions: Opt for o
ne of our generous pension fund plans and do not worry about the accident insurance as we fully cover it for you.  Parents@EY: Our benefits specially 
designed for parents at EY will help you focus on Work-Life integration.  Mentoring Program: in addition to career counselling within your team, you w
ill have the chance to choose one of our leaders as your mentor, to support and help you in your career goals and growth path.  Social Responsibility:
 at EY, you will have the chance to make a positive impact by joining one of our EY Ripples programs, designed specifically to support different socia
l initiatives within Switzerland and abroad.  Social Equity: ​EY has a commitment to advancing diversity, equity and inclusiveness (DE&I) and driving 
sustainable change for greater social equity. We recognize that people have different starting points, circumstances, backgrounds and identities, expe
riences and needs, which we all need to better understand. Social equity is about clearing obstacles,building more inclusive environments and enabling

Manager, Applied ResearchThomson Reuters (Markets) Europe AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:10 Mai 2024Pensum:100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:Zu
gManager, Applied ResearchAre you excited about working at the forefront of applied research in an industry setting? Thomson Reuters Labs in Zug is se
eking a hands-on people manager to lead a team of high performing applied scientists, with a passion for solving problems using state-of-the-art Infor
mation Retrieval, Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning. What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support
 the organization and our customers through applied research in informational retrieval, natural language processing and machine learning. We work clo
sely with product and domain experts to identify compelling solutions at the intersection of user need and technical feasibility. Our team is responsi
ble for designing the next generation of research technology for Legal and Tax Professionals in the US, UK, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. We own
 AI innovation for Thomson Reuters’ core research products, including Westlaw, Practical Law, and Checkpoint. The Labs Legal Technology team is seekin
g an exceptional manager to lead a cross-functional team with significant product scope. This team is responsible for designing, developing, and deliv
ering AI capabilities to Thomson Reuters' Legal Technology product portfolio focusing on contract drafting and review. These products include CoCounse
l, CoCounsel Drafting, Document Intelligence, HighQ, Contract Express, and Legal Tracker, among others. As a manager on this team, you will directly i
nfluence AI strategy and the feature roadmap through ideation and rapid prototyping in close collaboration with Product and Design counterparts. In ad
dition to research and prototyping, this team also writes functional, scalable, and reliable software that runs in our products. The combined scope re
quires a highly efficient, agile approach to both research and development. Strong experimental design and evaluation are also essential given the com
plexity of the domain and the high stakes nature of the work our customers rely on our technology to perform." As Manager, Applied Research you will: 
Lead: You will build a high performing team through servant leadership by setting clear expectations, modeling expected behaviors and actively coachin
g. You will be a proactive communicator who is excited to share their work and even more excited to highlight the accomplishments of their team. You w
ill be articulate and compelling in describing ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences. Deliver: With a sense of urgency and the desire to
 work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, you will translate complex business problems into solutions with clearly defined outcomes and break down c
omplex ideas into tractable incremental milestones. You will drive the end-to-end model development lifecycle partnering effectively with a collaborat
ive cross-functional team. Our problems are complex; our solutions are right-sized. You will be accountable for timely, well-managed software delivera
bles. Innovate: You will be empowered to try new approaches, learn new technologies, and take informed risks with good judgement. Furthermore, you wil
l encourage and empower your team to do the same. You will foster innovative ideas to solve real-world challenges. You will help lead the way in growi
ng the understanding and adoption of AI, NLP and IR across the enterprise. You are a fit for the role of Manager, Applied Research if you have: PhD in
 a relevant discipline or Master’s plus a comparable level of experience At least 5 years practical, relevant experience building NLP/IR/ML systems, f
rom ideation to production The willingness and ability to write clean, production-ready code (in python, mostly) Experience coaching and developing a 
team Demonstrable experience translating complex business problems into solutions with clearly defined scope and executing on that vision with demonst
rated success At least 8 years practical experience building IR, ML or NLP systems. Experience innovating with state-of-the-art research to solve appl
ied, real-world problems successfully Experience in a fast-paced, agile environment managing uncertainty and ambiguity Outstanding communication and d
ata-driven decision-making Experience delivering minimum viable products in a large enterprise environment Publications at workshops or conferences su
ch as ACL, EMNLP, KDD, ICML, NeurIPS, SIGIR, or similar What's in it For You?  You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are
 committed to your personal and professional growth through: Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week i
n the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected Wellb
eing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off;
 work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Heads
pace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial well
being. Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more. Lear
ning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees T
homson Reuters café networking. Social Impact: Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social a
nd Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact. Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much prid
e as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the pr
ofessionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide tr
usted, unbiased information to people all over the world.  LI-IG1 DISCLAIMER The above information in this description has been designed to indicate t
he general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehens
ive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Do you want to be part of a team helping

mson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabl
ed software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help t
hese professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, gover

ence ArchitectSind «Big Data» und «AI» für dich mehr als nur Schlagwörter? Motiviert dich die Herausforderung, Machine-Learning Prozesse End-to-End zu
 automatisieren? Hast du Erfahrung damit, analytische Resultate in eine heterogene unternehmensweite Software Landschaft zu integrieren? Dann bist du 
der Datendompteur, den wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung an unseren Standort in Zürich Oerlikon suchen.Aufgaben Zusammen mit dem Solution Architek

mentieren. Du übernimmst im Rahmen unseres agilen Vorgehens die Rolle des Product-Owners für ausgewählte Analytics Applikationen und präsentierst rege
lmässig den Fortschritt in Projektmeetings. Du verfasst Architektur- und Entwicklungsrichtlinien und hilfst uns bei der Umsetzung der ML‑Ops Strategie

Postdoctoral Researcher - Data scientist in remote sensing and photogrammetryUniversität ZürichBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:19 März 2024Pensum:100
%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZürichPostdoctoral Researcher - Data scientist in remote sensing and photogrammetryThe announced postdoctoral resear
cher is part of the new Remote Sensing of Environmental Changes group within the Remote Sensing Laboratories at the Department of Geography, Universit
y of Zurich. Remote sensing is vital in documenting and monitoring environmental changes worldwide. Analyzing remote sensing data is complex, and find
ing solutions often requires custom-tailored algorithms. For what concerns environmental changes, most problems come with additional challenges, i.e.,
 dealing with the inherent limitations of each sensor and platform and determining how to apply solutions at different scales. The research group aims
 to address these challenges and to make an impact in quantifying, understanding, and mitigating environmental changes in the cryosphere, forestry, an
d geomorphology. To this end, we aim to address fundamental and methodological questions in remote sensing. Yet, several challenges exist, including m
anaging the sheer volume and variety of geospatial data available from open and commercial sensors and across different spatial and temporal resolutio
ns. Furthermore, the imminent launch of new satellite missions will open new research perspectives.  Postdoctoral Researcher - Data scientist in remot
e sensing and photogrammetry    Your responsibilities The candidate will have a central role in the research group by addressing the following methodo
logical and technological research topics in close collaboration with all team members. You will be responsible for managing the satellite data archiv
e and developing algorithms/tools that facilitate organization, and access to the data for the team's research and teaching activities. You are expect
ed to develop image processing and analysis tools to support the team, including artificial intelligence and machine learning for geospatial remote se
nsing datasets. You will be part of the team contributing to developing open-source and modular processing pipelines for accurately generating DEM tim
e series and elevation information. These solutions can complement already available pipelines such as xDEM. Subsequently, advanced time series optica
l and SAR data analysis will be created with the PhDs for change detection analysis, including developing satellite radar interferometric ground motio
n time series. Furthermore, the multiple sensor-platform approach aims to calibrate/validate satellite observation at local, regional, and global scal
es. You will also collaborate in the planning and teaching of courses in the field of remote sensing at the department. You are welcome to develop you
r research activities and ideas through joint proposals or as principal investigator and apply for funding through national and international opportun
ities, including ESA calls.     Your profile We seek an enthusiastic, creative, and independent researcher interested in working with various remote s
ensing data to quantify changes in cryosphere, forestry, and geomorphology. Specifically, the research topics will cover a broad range of technology a
nd environmental sciences, including but not only glacier changes in elevation and velocity, periglacial changes due to glacier retreat and related ma
ss movements, spatiotemporal changes in forest cover and height along with the characterization of vertical and horizontal forest structures. Remote s
ensing data include historical and digital aerial images, airborne Lidar, optical satellite data, synthetic aperture radar (SAR), satellite laser and 
radar altimetry. In addition, research will also involve the simulation and use of upcoming ESA and NASA satellite missions.  Requirements The candida
te must be able to multitask and work on various projects and applications independently and in collaboration with the team members and other colleagu
es. The applicant should have problem-solving skills and good organizational and communication skills. Advanced programming and computational skills, 
software development, geospatial data analysis and visualization, GIS and Remote Sensing concepts are required. The team will primarily use Python, QG
IS, ArcGIS, and project tracking systems (e.g., GitHub). Fluent English is a requirement. German is not required, but it facilitates communication wit
h the administrative and other members. The candidate will benefit from a close network of collaboration with the Remote Sensing Laboratories at the d
epartment and established international collaborations, such as with the Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research (WSL), Instit
ute for Snow and Avalanche Research (SLF), University of Oslo, World Glacier Monitoring Service, TU Wien, German Aerospace Center (DLR), Ulster Univer
sity, University Grenoble Alpes, TU Dresden, University of Toulouse, Catholic University of Eichstätt-Ingolstadt, and University of Innsbruck. Interac
tions with supported science IT teams will be required to address large-scale computational research data processing and management.   What we offer T
he team will be built on the values of collaboration, diversity, respect, initiative, and open science. The drivers of the research group are sharing 
experiences, ideas, and approaches, learning from each other, and returning what we have learned to the group and the community. We offer outstanding 
working conditions, a high quality of life in Zurich, excellent support and a flexible work environment that fosters collaboration and teamwork. Emplo
yment is 80 % for three years with a possibility of extension of another three years. The salary is defined by the level of the employee's career and 
age following the salary regulations of the UZH.   Further information  E-Mail schreiben KontaktUniversität Zürich(0)140 Jobshttps://www.bascompte.net

PhD - Unlocking historical aerial image archive for understanding environmental changesUniversität ZürichBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:19 März 2024
Pensum:100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZürichPhD - Unlocking historical aerial image archive for understanding environmental changesThe announced
 PhD position is part of the new Remote Sensing of Environmental Changes group. Remote sensing is vital in documenting and monitoring environmental ch
anges worldwide. Analysing remote sensing data is complex, and finding solutions often requires custom-tailored algorithms. For what concerns environm
ental changes, most problems come with additional challenges, i.e., dealing with the inherent limitations of each sensor and platform and determining 
how to apply solutions at different scales.The research group aims to address these challenges and to make an impact in quantifying, understanding, an
d mitigating environmental changes in the cryosphere, forestry, and geomorphology. To this end, we aim to address fundamental and methodological quest
ions in remote sensing. Yet, several challenges exist, including managing the sheer volume and variety of geospatial data available from open and comm
ercial sensors and across different spatial and temporal resolutions. Furthermore, the imminent launch of new satellite missions will open new researc
h perspectives. The PhD project intends to exploit the potential of historical aerial images acquired worldwide from the early 1920s until the 2000s. 
This data is a unique and untapped resource that provides the only evidence of the earth's surface over the last century and can be used to create dig
ital elevation models (DEMs) through photogrammetric processing if sufficient stereo coverage is available.In recent years, there has been a growing i
nterest in using this data in the context of climate change and rapid human development. However, this data poses several challenges, such as distorti
on during digitisation, lack of metadata, and poor image quality, which can compromise the quality and success of photogrammetric processing. As a res
ult, new pipelines have been developed to address these challenges and automate data processing.The project aims to develop solutions to process histo
rical aerial images to generate accurate elevation information. Exciting historical aerial images from the Trimetrogon flights over glacierised areas 
in Patagonia have been scanned and are available for use in the PhD project. Additional historical images will be purchased to exploit the potential o
f this data over other glacierised areas in the Chilean Andes and worldwide. Change detection analysis will subsequently be conducted to quantify glac
ier and proglacial changes in the observed area. This will include analysing DEMs from modern data acquired by very high-resolution airborne and satel
lite images. Apart from 3D surface reconstruction, historical images are a valuable source of information for detecting changes in land cover using or
thorectified images. Further research could involve the development of artificial intelligence and deep learning solutions for image segmentation and 
quantifying land cover changes over time (e.g., Dahle et al., 2024).  PhD - Unlocking historical aerial image archive for understanding environmental 
changes    Your responsibilities   Developing and implementing research questions. Testing new photogrammetric pipelines (e.g., Knuth et al., 2023; Ma
iwald et al., 2023; Zhang et al., 2021) for processing historical aerial images using commercial and open-source solutions. Sensitivity study with Tri
metrogon flights or other available data aiming at improving our understanding of the impact of photogrammetric processing on the DEM quality. Impleme
ntation of solutions for correcting image distortion introduced during the scanning processing and storage. Applying the photogrammetric processing pi
peline to reconstruct DEM time series from different datasets. Quantify the accuracy and uncertainty of the generated DEMs to assess the significance 
of detected changes. Develop DEM time series methods analysis to extract elevation change information and analyse changes over time, including machine
 learning approaches. Image deep learning segmentation for characterising surface landcover and landcover changes. Presentation of research results at
 conferences and publishing results in peer-reviewed journals. Contribution to the teaching of remote sensing courses. Close collaboration with resear
ch partners at the University of Zurich, University of Magallanes, Swiss Federal Institute for Forest, Snow and Landscape Research (WSL), University o
f Toulouse, and TU Wien.     Your profile You have completed a M.Sc. degree in photogrammetry, remote sensing, computer vision, physical geography, ea
rth systems science, physics, or related fields. A strong interest and possibly some experience in image processing, photogrammetry, computer vision,

Rodent 3R Platform Specialist ETH ZürichBewerbenJob merkenAuf einen BlickVeröffentlicht:08 Mai 2024Pensum:80 – 100%Vertrag:TemporärSprache:Englisch (F
liessend)Arbeitsort:Zürich  Rodent 3R Platform Specialist  We are looking for an experienced scientist to co-manage the operational side of the rodent
 3R-Hub affiliated with our lab, and lead our efforts to implement reduce-refine-replace (3R) principles. In this position you will further develop an
d refine existing behavior testing setups, design and build equipment for new behavior setups, and conduct experiments to optimize the behavior tests.
 You will be able to solve engineering and data integration problems at the interface between behavior testing and in vivo brain recordings. You will 
be responsible for updating our state-of-the-art behavior analysis pipelines based on the latest developments in artificial intelligence and machine l
earning. You will train and guide collaborators during experimental design and data analysis. The position is currently limited to two years, but part
 of your job will be to strategically support our effort to develop it into a permanent position through careful alignment of our 3R-efforts with ETH 
strategies.  Project background  The mission of the ETH Zurich 3R Hub is to drive measurable and positive change in scientific animal research by prom
oting the principles of Replace, Reduce, and Refine. The 3R Hub aims to consolidate ongoing 3R research efforts across ETH Zurich. Through collaborati
ve research, education, and the exploration of alternative methods, we strive to minimize the impact on animals in experimental settings, whilst maxim
izing the information gained from each animal used in research. The hub has recently been launched, and the demand for collaborations is already very 
high. Thus, we are looking for someone to join the current head of the 3R Hub as a co-leader, to manage ongoing projects and develop and implement a v
ision for how to exapand and permanently integrate the hub within the ETH ecosystem.  Job description  In this position you will be responsible for th
e successful operation of our 3R-Hub and ensure that it meets the changing needs of a dynamic research environment. As part of this job, you will...  
maintain and further develop existing state-of-the-art behavior analysis, including physical maintenance of equipment and design of new upgrades conti
nuously implement the latest analyses algorithms/approaches for animal tracking and data analysis, as well as benchmarking the performance of the new 
approaches establish new behavioral tasks and behavior setups aligned with the research directions of the research group. This includes designing, dra
wing and physically building new equipment and testing its functionality using studies with proper experimental design train new employees who use the
 animal testing platform, to maintain the high standard of behavior analysis in the group. Specifically, you will ensure that group members can operat
e and maintain behavior equipment, properly conduct behavioral experiments, and collect and correctly analyze the behavioral data stay up-to-date with
 developments in 3R research, write grants and design experiments to further 3R initiatives lead group or collaborator meetings related to behavior te
sting, present new capabilities developed by the 3R-Hub contribute to the writing and reviewing of scientific papers related to rodent behavior testin
g identify and connect with collaboration partners in the greater Zurich neuroscience communiy (Neuroscience Center Zurich)   Your profile  The job pr
ofile requires:  A degree in neuroscience and/or engineering (or related field) and a proven track record of desiging and building behavior testing eq
uipment (hands-on, practical skills) A PhD in neuroscience with proven publication track record ideally a few years of postdoc or equivalent position 
with leadership experience >5 years experience and in-depth knowledge in rodent behavioral neuroscience research A publication track record that demon
strates successful development and implementation of behavior analysis approaches A proven track record in grant writing and securing indepenent fundi
ng Fluency in English Up-to-date knowledge of latest technological developments in the field of behavior testing Proficiency in programming languages 
(Python is a requirement) Experience working with machine learning approaches Excellent interpersonal skills in order to coordinate and balance the ne
eds and requirements of group members in a dynamic and interdisciplinary research environment Creative/adaptive problem solving skills   We offer   A 
caring, supportive and modern work environment based on trust and respect A uniquely stimulating scientific environment with a cutting-edge research l
ab embedded in the greater Zurich Neuroscience Center (ZNZ) Flexible working hours (incl. the option for home office) that are compatible with a healt
hy work/life balance Opportunities for furthering education and continued learning The possibility to take responsibilty in guiding projects and mento
ring students Meaningful work with a long-term vision to advance our understanding of brain function    Working, teaching and research at ETH Zurich  
 We value diversity In line with  our values  , ETH Zurich encourages an inclusive culture. We promote equality of opportunity, value diversity and nu
rture a working and learning environment in which the rights and dignity of all our staff and students are respected. Visit our  Equal Opportunities a
nd Diversity website   to find out how we ensure a fair and open environment that allows everyone to grow and flourish. Curious? So are we.  We look f
orward to receiving your online application with the following documents:  Curriculum Vitae incl. Publication List A short statement (max. 250 words) 
summarizing your work experience and why you think you are the ideal candiate for the position  Please note that we exclusively accept applications su
bmitted through our online application portal. Applications via email or postal services will not be considered. Further information about our lab can
 be found on our lab's  website   and the 3R-Hub's  homepage  . Questions regarding the position should be directed to Dr. Oliver Sturman, Write an em
ail (no applications). For recruitment services the  GTC of ETH Zurich   apply.  About ETH Zürich ETH Zurich is one of the world’s leading universitie
s specialising in science and technology. We are renowned for our excellent education, cutting-edge fundamental research and direct transfer of new kn
owledge into society. Over 30,000 people from more than 120 countries find our university to be a place that promotes independent thinking and an envi
ronment that inspires excellence. Located in the heart of Europe, yet forging connections all over the world, we work together to develop solutions fo

sort:ZürichTrainee Actuary/Data ScientistTrainee Actuary/Data Scientist Trainee Actuary/Data Scientist ¿Te interesaría trabajar en un ambiente estimul
ante y orientado a negocio? ¡Únete al equipo de Pricing & Analytics de Sabadell Zurich! Sabadell Zurich es una entidad que nace de la alianza entre Ba
nc Sabadell y Zurich para la distribución de seguros a través de los canales bancarios. Siendo la unión entre un prestigioso banco reconocido por su c
ontribución al desarrollo de las empresas y una compañía internacional experta en la protección y el cuidado de las personas, en Sabadell Zurich tenem
os dos orígenes distintos, pero un solo propósito: ESTAR PARA CUIDAR. ¿Quiénes somos? Sabadell Zurich es una joint venture que nace en 2008 como fruto
 del acuerdo empresarial entre Banc Sabadell y Zurich para la gestión del negocio de Bancaseguros. Está integrada por tres compañías distintas: BanSab
adell Vida, BanSabadell Pensiones y BanSabadell Seguros Generales; la propiedad de las cuales está compartida al 50% entre ambos socios. La plantilla 
de Sabadell Zurich está formada por alrededor de 300 personas, quienes, a nivel organizacional, se contabilizan como parte de la estructura de Grupo Z
urich en España. Tus Responsabilidades Como Trainee Actuary/Data Scientist, la persona seleccionada se responsabilizará, bajo supervisión, de desarrol
lar soluciones analíticas para obtener conocimientos de los datos y apoyar las decisiones estratégicas. Al mismo tiempo, formará parte de un equipo an
alítico de gran experiencia que, basándose en la analítica avanzada, asesorará a las áreas y procesos de negocio más importantes de la compañía. Para 
ello, sus principales funciones serán:  Transformar y depurar los datos para proporcionar asesoramiento y conocimientos técnicos sobre los modelos act
uariales y las cuestiones de riesgo. Desarrollar cuadros de mando analíticos para ayudar en el seguimiento del rendimiento del negocio. Iniciación en 
el desarrollo y la mejora de las herramientas de modelización predictiva de acuerdo con las mejores prácticas del mercado como Modelización de pricing
, Ingeniería inversa a partir de la información del mercado, Modelos de elasticidad para renovaciones y modelos de descuento. Técnicas de Machine Lear
ning como métodos supervisados y no supervisados. Pruebas y mantenimiento de modelos y herramientas actuales. Aprender desde el punto de vista del neg
ocio. Estar en contacto durante toda la vida de la póliza (producto, suscripción, renovación, siniestros, cancelación, fraude...) Apoyo en la Investig
ación de nuevos enfoques como web scrapping, análisis de textos, procesamientos de imágenes, etc.  Tus habilidades y experiencias Esperamos que la per
sona que se incorpore en el equipo reúna las siguientes habilidades y experiencias:  Formación universitaria relacionada con Física, Matemáticas, Esta
dística, Ingeniería o Ciencias Actuariales. Herramientas estadísticas y de programación como Python, R, SAS, SQL u otros lenguajes de programación est
adística. Inglés B2. Experiencia en el proceso de transformación, limpieza y calidad de datos. Adicionalmente, se valorará muy positivamente: Experien
cia en el sector de seguros, banca, farmacéutica, venta masiva, mercado on-line y otros sectores afines. Experiencia en entorno actuarial (Emblem, Rad
ar y GLM). Experiencia en herramientas de BI (PowerBI, Tableau, QlikView). Experiencia con Plataformas en la nube (Azure, AWS, Google). Capacidad anal
ítica y desarrollo de nuevos enfoques. Capacidad de síntesis e interpretación de resultados. Capacidad de aprendizaje, comunicación y trabajo en equip
o. Proactividad e implicación, autonomía y orientación a la mejora continua.  Información Imprescindible  Se requiere poder realizar un convenio de co
laboración con la Universidad y/o Escuela de Negocios de un mínimo de 6 meses con posibilidad de extensión. Jornada parcial de 9 h a 14 h. Agradecería
mos que antes de aplicar a esta vacante de prácticas, donde establecer un convenio de colaboración con la Universidad y/o Escuela de Negocios de un mí
nimo de 6 meses es imprescindible, dispusieras de la siguiente información al respecto: Confirmación de la posibilidad de llevar a cabo el convenio. D
uración del convenio (meses) teniendo en cuenta que la jornada es parcial, y posibilidad de extensión del mismo. Fecha de inicio del convenio. Modalid
ad: curriculares o extracurriculares. Contacto de la persona de referencia con la que gestionaremos el convenio.  Ventajas y descuentos por ser de Sab
adell Zurich Porque nuestro propósito es Estar para Cuidar sumamos más beneficios para ti:  A partir del primer mes de tu incorporación y según acorda
do con tu tutor, podrás trabajar tanto desde la oficina como desde casa. Disfruta de la gran variedad de espacios que ofrece nuestras oficinas enfocad
as a cubrir las necesidades y el bienestar personal. En Sabadell Zurich no tenemos problemas de aparcamiento, ya que disponemos de plazas de moto, bic
icleta y patinete eléctrico gratuitas en las oficinas. En Sabadell Zurich promovemos las actividades de voluntariado y ¡queremos animarte a participar
! Nos importa la inclusión laboral, por eso, trabajamos con varios centros especiales de trabajo que promueven la inclusión de diversidad funcional, p
or ejemplo, en nuestro servicio de fisioterapia, la limpieza de las oficinas, la fruta fresca, ecológica y de proximidad que disponemos en la oficina.

m SpecialistRodent 3R Platform Specialist 80%-100%, Zurich, fixed-term We are looking for an experienced scientist to co-manage the operational side o
f the rodent 3R-Hub affiliated with our lab, and lead our efforts to implement reduce-refine-replace (3R) principles. In this position you will furthe
r develop and refine existing behavior testing setups, design and build equipment for new behavior setups, and conduct experiments to optimize the beh
avior tests. You will be able to solve engineering and data integration problems at the interface between behavior testing and in vivo brain recording
s. You will be responsible for updating our state-of-the-art behavior analysis pipelines based on the latest developments in artificial intelligence a
nd machine learning. You will train and guide collaborators during experimental design and data analysis. The position is currently limited to two yea
rs, but part of your job will be to strategically support our effort to develop it into a permanent position through careful alignment of our 3R-effor
ts with ETH strategies. Project background The mission of the ETH Zurich 3R Hub is to drive measurable and positive change in scientific animal resear
ch by promoting the principles of Replace, Reduce, and Refine. The 3R Hub aims to consolidate ongoing 3R research efforts across ETH Zurich. Through c
ollaborative research, education, and the exploration of alternative methods, we strive to minimize the impact on animals in experimental settings, wh
ilst maximizing the information gained from each animal used in research. The hub has recently been launched, and the demand for collaborations is alr
eady very high. Thus, we are looking for someone to join the current head of the 3R Hub as a co-leader, to manage ongoing projects and develop and imp
lement a vision for how to exapand and permanently integrate the hub within the ETH ecosystem. Job description In this position you will be responsibl
e for the successful operation of our 3R-Hub and ensure that it meets the changing needs of a dynamic research environment. As part of this job, you w
ill...  maintain and further develop existing state-of-the-art behavior analysis, including physical maintenance of equipment and design of new upgrad
es continuously implement the latest analyses algorithms/approaches for animal tracking and data analysis, as well as benchmarking the performance of 
the new approaches establish new behavioral tasks and behavior setups aligned with the research directions of the research group. This includes design
ing, drawing and physically building new equipment and testing its functionality using studies with proper experimental design train new employees who
 use the animal testing platform, to maintain the high standard of behavior analysis in the group. Specifically, you will ensure that group members ca
n operate and maintain behavior equipment, properly conduct behavioral experiments, and collect and correctly analyze the behavioral data stay up-to-d
ate with developments in 3R research, write grants and design experiments to further 3R initiatives lead group or collaborator meetings related to beh
avior testing, present new capabilities developed by the 3R-Hub contribute to the writing and reviewing of scientific papers related to rodent behavio
r testing identify and connect with collaboration partners in the greater Zurich neuroscience communiy (Neuroscience Center Zurich)  Your profile The 
job profile requires:  A degree in neuroscience and/or engineering (or related field) and a proven track record of desiging and building behavior test
ing equipment (hands-on, practical skills) A PhD in neuroscience with proven publication track record ideally a few years of postdoc or equivalent pos
ition with leadership experience >5 years experience and in-depth knowledge in rodent behavioral neuroscience research A publication track record that
 demonstrates successful development and implementation of behavior analysis approaches A proven track record in grant writing and securing indepenent
 funding Fluency in English Up-to-date knowledge of latest technological developments in the field of behavior testing Proficiency in programming lang
uages (Python is a requirement) Experience working with machine learning approaches Excellent interpersonal skills in order to coordinate and balance 
the needs and requirements of group members in a dynamic and interdisciplinary research environment Creative/adaptive problem solving skills  Your wor
kplace Your workplace We offer  A caring, supportive and modern work environment based on trust and respect A uniquely stimulating scientific environm
ent with a cutting-edge research lab embedded in the greater Zurich Neuroscience Center (ZNZ) Flexible working hours (incl. the option for home office
) that are compatible with a healthy work/life balance Opportunities for furthering education and continued learning The possibility to take responsib
ilty in guiding projects and mentoring students Meaningful work with a long-term vision to advance our understanding of brain function  We value diver
sity Curious? So are we. We look forward to receiving your online application with the following documents:  Curriculum Vitae incl. Publication List A
 short statement (max. 250 words) summarizing your work experience and why you think you are the ideal candiate for the position  Please note that we 
exclusively accept applications submitted through our online application portal. Applications via email or postal services will not be considered. Fur
ther information about our lab can be found on our lab's website and the 3R-Hub's homepage. Questions regarding the position should be directed to Dr.
 Oliver Sturman, E-Mail schreiben (no applications). For recruitment services the GTC of ETH Zurich apply. About ETH Zürich Curious? So are we. We loo

ar Engineering for Architecture 100%, Zurich, fixed-term The Chair of Circular Engineering for Architecture (CEA) is seeking a highly motivated and qu
alified postdoctoral candidate in the field of digital technologies for circular economy in the construction sector. The successful candidate will joi
n a dynamic research team working on innovative approaches to enhance circular construction practices. This position offers a unique opportunity to co
ntribute to the development of tools and strategies that promote circular management of building components and projects, enabling a more sustainable 
and regenerative built environment. Project background The postdoctoral position is focused on leveraging digitalization for circular strategies in co
nstruction. The selected candidate will be involved in developing and testing tools related to topics such as reality capture, quality assessment, 3D 
modelling, computer vision and computational design in the built environment, operating at the intersection of construction informatics, engineering, 
and logistical aspects. Job description  Development of theoretical concepts for tools leveraging digital technologies for circular construction, faci
litating circular processes along the value chain (identification and categorization of reusable materials, design with reused elements, etc.) in the 
construction sector Exploration of implementation possibilities for automated workflows and digital technologies in new and existing construction proj
ects Use immersive technologies to enhance construction processes and training Active participation in research activities, including publishing scien
tific papers and presenting findings at conferences and workshops Supervision of Master, and/or Bachelor students, as well as teaching  Your profile

Internship / Master Thesis : Digital Twin Security Framework for Smart citiesElca informatique SABewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:13 April 2024Pensum:
100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:LausanneInternship / Master Thesis : Digital Twin Security Framework for Smart cities About ELCA We are ELCA, one
 of the largest Swiss IT tribe with over 2,200 experts. We are multicultural with offices in Switzerland, Spain, Italy, France, Vietnam and Mauritius.
 Since 1968, our team of engineers, business analysts, software architects, designers and consultants provide tailor-made and standardized solutions t
o support the digital transformation of major public administrations and private companies in Switzerland. Our activity spans across multiples fields 
of leading-edge technologies such as AI, Machine & Deep learning, BI/BD, RPA, Blockchain, IoT and CyberSecurity.    his internship is part of the 4-ye
ar-long Blue City project from Innosuisse. The Blue City Project is a transdisciplinary consortium aiming to map a city’s multi-layered, interconnecte
d network of flows (traffic, waste, energy, …) and create a responsive Urban Digital Twin for the digitally transformed, post-pandemic world.  A Digit
al Twin (DT) is a digital representation of a real-world entity or system. It reflects a single physical object, process, organisation, person, or oth
er abstraction. DT enables true two-way communication between the physical and the digital world. Combined with Artificial Intelligence and Deep Learn
ing technology, a Digital twin platform will assist evidence-based, collective decisions to improve urban well-being, sustainability, resilience, and 
maximize ecological value. In the context of this internship, we aim at implementing a prototype of secure data sharing between digital twins. We will
 use real case data models from Blue City actors. It implies the following activities:  Take over the security framework from past internships  Analyz
e cross-organization use cases with our partner ecosystem Implement the prototype for selected use cases Extend and adapt the security framework based
 on learnings.       A dynamic work and collaborative environment with a highly motivated multi-cultural and multiples international sites team Person
al development through training and coaching A flat hierarchy and a culture of collaboration across all disciplines The chance to make a difference in
 peoples’ life by building innovative solutions High innovation and research backed up by collaboration with universities like EPFL Various internal c
oding events (Hackathon, Brownbags), see our technical blog  Monthly After-Works organized per locations Good life balance (41 working hours per week 
and possibility to work 2 days per week from home.       Software development: Python Interest for semantic interoperability and data models Interest 
for security: Zero-Trust, service mesh security (istio, kuma, …) Interest for distributed systems, cloud (Azure, AWS) and devops technologies (Docker,
 Kubernetes, K3s) KontaktELCA Informatique SA(0)29 JobsBewerbenJob merkenDiesen Job melden

Careers at IBM Research Europe, ZurichIBM Research GmbHBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:12 Januar 2024Pensum:100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:Züri
chCareers at IBM Research Europe, ZurichAbout cookies on this site Our websites require some cookies to function properly (required). In addition, oth
er cookies may be used with your consent to analyze site usage, improve the user experience and for advertising. For more information, please review y
our options. By visiting our website, you agree to our processing of information as described in IBM’sprivacy statement. To provide a smooth navigatio
n, your cookie preferences will be shared across the IBM web domains listed here. Master's thesis Designing Large-Scale Satellite-Agnostic Geospatial 
Foundation Models In this project, you will develop and evaluate novel ways to build satellite-agnostic geospatial foundation models that are capable 
of processing multi-resolution data from diverse sensors during pretraining and finetuning in a computationally efficient way. The project is executed
 together with the Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing Group at ETH Zurich and requires an affiliation with ETH. The project provides access to IBM HPC 
infrastructure. Significant progress in the development of highly adaptable and reusable artificial intelligence (AI) models is expected to have a maj
or impact on earth science and remote sensing. Foundation models are pre-trained on large unlabeled datasets via self-supervision and subsequently fin
e-tuned with small, labeled datasets for various downstream tasks. The abundance of unlabeled data from multiple satellites makes remote sensing an id
eal domain for pre-training large-scale foundation models. However, recent foundation models for geospatial analysis and remote sensing applications e
xploit only a fraction of the available bands, typically from a single satellite or at constant resolutions. Consequently, the scientific community is
 increasingly interested in developing approaches to build interoperable (i.e., satellite-agnostic) models for Earth observation and remote sensing th
at efficiently exploit multi-sensor, multi-resolution data. Goal This project aims to explore transformer models to result in interoperable, multi-res
olution geospatial foundation models that encode information from various bands. This is an essential step in further enhancing AI models for remote s
ensing to unlock diverse environmental applications. Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in computer science, deep learning or a related technical field
, including equivalent practical experience Python, PyTorch, Linux, GitHub/Lab Problem-solving mindset: ability to explore technical literature, cross
-referencing relevant information, synthesis of novel ML architectures Ways to stand out: hands-on experience with HPC systems and job scheduling, pri
or encounters with large-scale transformer architectures, especially with positional encodings, etc.  Diversity IBM is committed to diversity at the w
orkplace. With us you will find an open, multicultural environment. Excellent flexible working arrangements enable all genders to strike the desired b
alance between their professional development and their personal lives. How to apply If you are interested in this exciting position, please submit yo
ur application through the link below.KontaktIBM Research GmbHBewerbenJob merkenDiesen Job melden

ro.  Offriamo  Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di ricerca e a conferenze internazionali. Ambiente di lavoro giovane, dinamico, in continua evolu
zione, composto da un team motivato e in crescita. Salario in linea con gli standard svizzeri e l’esperienza del candidato. Un contratto a tempo deter

Strategic Procurement ManagerDaedalean AGBewerbenJob merkenVeröffentlicht:30 April 2024Pensum:100%Vertrag:FestanstellungArbeitsort:ZürichStrategic Pro
curement Manager Daedalean is a Zürich-based startup founded in 2016 by experienced engineers who want to completely revolutionize air travel within t
he next decade. The company has 100+ people and we combine computer vision, deep learning, and robotics to develop full “level-5” autonomy for flying 
vehicles, both existing aircraft and the electric VTOLs that you may have seen in the media.        Your Role:  You will actively contribute to the fo
rmulation, execution and evolution of procurement strategies related to locating, evaluating, contracting and maintaining the best sources of supply f
or the materials and services required by the Development teams while considering all aspects such as quality, value, performance, cost and the abilit
y to respond quickly to changing supply requirements, incl. licensing and logistics services. You will take the ownership, responsibility and accounta
bility for supplier and vendor selection and development. \n     Your Tasks:  Establish and implement procurement strategy of aircraft system componen
ts, services and contract negotiations Negotiate, create and manage terms and conditions for contracts with chosen suppliers. Driving an active and su
ccessful supplier management process Conducting price negotiations, cost monitoring and cost reductions Maintaining continuous and timely procurement 
related data, documenting and archiving procurement data according to internal processes Handling Supplier Change Requests (SCR), managing obsolescenc
e and Problem Reports (PR) processes Collaborating with internal departments as well as suppliers strategically Ensure setting up of tools and process
es to achieve the above Establish, implement and maintain inventory management system Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to monitor and manage sup
plier performance against agreed-upon metrics. Leading one employee in the procurement department     Preferred Qualifications and Experience:  You ar
e smart and get stuff done. Have a degree in purchasing, supply chain management, business administration, Engineering or another related field. At le
ast 10 years professional experience in aerospace procurement in a global environment. Experience in maintaining, developing, and implementing procure
ment processes and strategies as well as contract management. A proven track record in leadership or motivated to gain their first leadership experien
ce Experience in quality management, ideally in EN 9100 or Part 21G/J is highly desired. Your confident and communicative nature, coupled with a high 
level of service awareness, makes it easy for you to deal with customers and suppliers. You will be able to work independently and in a structured man
ner, contributing to a solution-oriented and successful team. Full working proficiency in English, German and further languages are an advantage     B
enefits:  A team of experienced engineers and researchers, who joined us from most recognized companies and institutions. Difficult and interesting pr
oblems to solve.  Test flights in the Swiss Alps for you to join. Stock options. Pilot license subsidy. Hybrid work setting (2 days WFH per week). Lea

ungArbeitsort:GenfHedge fund analyst with quantitative background_Geneva Your team Pictet Asset Management (Pictet AM) manages the assets of some of t
he world’s largest institutions, financial intermediaries, and their clients. Within Pictet AM, our Total Return business is a leading European hedge 
Fund manager with a global presence and a wide range of strategies, ranging from directional to market neutral, as well as a multi-manager fund with a
 19-year track record. We are looking for a hedge fund analyst to work within our Total Return Equities team and help us continue to build and strengt
hen our processes through deep analyses across a wide variety of subject matter, including capital allocation decisions, risk management, working dire
ctly with some of the investment teams to help enhance their investment processes and decision making, and the use of alternative data. You will work 
in the Equity Total Return team and support the wider Total Return business with data management and insightful analyses. The successful candidate wil
l join a dynamic environment and be based in Geneva (preferred) or London. Your role Providing the investment committees of our multi-manager funds wi
th the transparency and insights needed to allocate capital to the various managers. Maintaining and further automating our data acquisition and proce
ssing infrastructure. Leading research aimed at improving the risk-adjusted performance of the multi-manager funds focusing on portfolio construction 
and tail-risk management; assessing, for this purpose, the usefulness of various data sources (macro data, hedge fund positioning and flows, crowding 
indicators, fundamental factor performance, alternative data, etc.) and several commercial risk models. Being willing to develop an in-depth understan
ding of many hedge fund strategies across asset classes, studying their diversification potential and helping with the quantitative assessment of cand
idate strategies. Working closely with our hedge fund managers to develop processes and tools aimed at enhancing risk awareness and improving investme
nt decision-making with the help of statistical and various types models. Collaborating with other quantitative analysts and data scientists at Pictet
 AM to identify useful patterns and signals from alternative data sources to enhance our investment processes. Building strong relationships with the 
Investment Risk, Investment Technology, and Reporting teams to enhance performance attribution, stress testing and the automation of reporting tasks. 
Your profile 3-5 years experience at a multi-manager hedge fund or possessing a strong and in-depth understanding of various hedge fund strategies (fu
ndamental, systematic, macro, and/or event driven). Quantitative background (university degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics, 
engineering, or quantitative finance). Expert level in Python and the standard data science packages (e.g., pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, SciPy, etc.) 
and comfortable with relational database programming (SQL). Previous experience with Snowflake, AWS, data visualisation tools and languages (Tableau),
 and machine learning would be a plus. Familiarity with fundamental factor risk models (Axioma, Bloomberg MAC2 & MAC3, Barra) would be a plus. Strong 
communication skills: ability to communicate results to a non-technical audience. Good command of English; French would be a plus. Note We will not ac
cept any CVs via agencies. REF: HFAQ/CM/FC Diversity & Inclusion Pictet is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse enviro
